generation

Class BSPBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.BSPBuilder

  • public class BSPBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has the responsibility to obtain the tree of BSP nodes for a given maze. This code is refactored code from MazeBuilder.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    • Method Detail

      • genNodes

        private BSPNode genNodes(java.util.ArrayList<Seg> sl)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Method generates the nodes. In every node, it has two section, left and right. It chooses the segment which has the minimum grade value and then split this node into two nodes through this segment. If all the segments in one node are partitioned, it will stop to split.
        Parameters:
        sl -
        Returns:
        root node for BSP tree
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • countNonPartitions

        private static int countNonPartitions(java.util.ArrayList<Seg> sl)
        Counts how many elements in the segment vector have their partition bit set to false
        Parameters:
        sl - all segments
        Returns:
        number of segments where the partition flag is not set

      • findPartitionCandidate

        private Seg findPartitionCandidate(java.util.ArrayList<Seg> sl)
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        It finds the segment which has the minimum grade value.
        Parameters:
        sl - vector of segment
        Returns:
        Segment that is best candidate according to grade partition (smallest grade)
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • grade_partition

        private int grade_partition(java.util.ArrayList<Seg> sl,
                            Seg pe)
        Method called in genNodes to determine the minimum of all such grades. The method is static, i.e. it does not update internal attributes and just calculates the returned value.
        Parameters:
        sl - vector of segments
        pe - particular segment
        Returns:
        undocumented
